stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: UPDATE - Indicators of Compromise Associated with LOCKY Ransomware
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description:
LOCKY Ransomware is an emerging threat currently being spread via phishing and spam campaigns delivering malicious attachments or links. When executed, LOCKY encrypts multiple victim files then presents a ransom prompt on the victim machine. To date, Locky Ransomware has targeted multiple sectors, including: Aviation, Financial, Government, and Health.
This is an UPDATE to IB-16-10045 (3/22/2016), IB-16-10045A (3/29/2016), IB-16-10045B (4/1/2016), IB-16-10045C (4/1/2016) and IB-16-10045D (4/5/2016). US-CERT was able to provide malware analysis on the new sample provided for the "D" version of this report, and have provided a YARA signature for detection purposes. All IOCs have changed from TLP AMBER to TLP GREEN for broader dissemination. Additional IOCs were added to the bottom of this file and are marked in the Description field as "New IOC added for IB-16-10045E".

marking:Marking_Structure.TOUMarking:Terms_Of_Use: This Indicator Bulletin is provided "as is" for informational purposes only. The Department of Homeland Security (DHS) does not provide any warranties of any kind regarding any information contained within. The DHS does not endorse any commercial product or service, referenced in this bulletin or otherwise. This document is marked TLP: GREEN. Recipients may only share TLP: GREEN information with peers and partner organizations within their sector or community, but not via publicly accessible channels.For more information on the Traffic Light Protocol, see http://www.us-cert.gov/tlp .

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious E-mail Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
The number strings in the below attachments examples appear to be random. Attachment examples include:
email.370822995.js email.218970607.js scan_00_391391.zip
--- Sample Email Body ---
Dear Customer,
The mistake made will be compensated promptly, please do not worry.
Please take a look at the file attached (scanned document) as it contains all the information.
Sincerely, Millicent Mathews Account Manager
---End of Body of email---

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious E-mail Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
One spear-phishing campaign related to LOCKY was seen between 9:44 AM ? 10:59 AM Eastern the morning of February 17, 2016 with a .docm file. Details of this campaign are identified below.
Subject: tracking documents
Sender Addresses: cmsharpscan8212@gmail.com cmsharpscan1269@gmail.com
Attachment: cmsharpscan@gmail.com_20160217_132046.docm (there is no further information currently available about this attachment)
http://46.4.239.76/main.php http://electro-cablaj.ro/system/logs/7623dh3f.exe?.7055475

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious E-mail Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
New IOC added for IB-16-10045B
On 23 March 2016, a trusted third party observed an ?Order?-themed phishing campaign attempting to deliver Locky Ransomware. The subjects followed a theme of using the word ?order? followed by random numbers (e.g. ?Order 676714?) with attachments using random characters (e.g. ?acaedfdc.js?).
Attachment variations included:
?details acaedfdc - copy.js? (MD5: 171af86d58fd39ceb570ae0dd62ad51e) ?eyyz? (MD5: 1340d89cbabd940bea0d2a8d2e0889e2) ?U4p? (MD5: b76dcdde3a49aa05ee3514b154dca5ae) ?c545065.js? (MD5: 767761d86106b68d179dc4a3046c3125)

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious File Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious E-mail Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:

This email sender delivered at least two different emails with "blank 2.docm" as the attachment and "blank 2" as the subject. The two different attachments had different MD5s:
4a2446dd8c97d8aba0202eb357f36ace 670230e35b3e08f6adbc1b28c6f8bbd1

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious URL Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
New IOC added for IB-16-10045C.
This URL was observed serving out Locky malware sample "78thg76.exe" (MD5: 6A83A846244DDB4203902127294FD995).

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious File Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
New IOC added for IB-16-10045C.
This Locky sample contains an embedded Domain Generation Algorithm which will dynamically generate URLs based on the victim system's date and time. This is beneficial to the attackers because they can predict the range of URLs which will be generated based on the current date and time. When the attackers want to communicate with the victim's system, they can register one of the URLs which will be generated, then wait for the malware to attempt a connection.
The file contains five embedded C2 IP addresses:
51.254.181[.]122 78.40.108[.]39 51.255.107[.]8 51.255.107[.]10 188.127.231[.]116
During the initial communication with the C2 server, the malware sent the following request:
POST /main.php HTTP/1.1 Host: [GENERATED URL] Content-Length: 101 Connection: Keep-Alive Cache-Control: no-cache [ENCODED DATA]
The initial communication to the C2 contains an encoded unique ID, a command to execute, and information about the victim system.
Below is a YARA signature provided by US-CERT for detection purposes:
rule LOCKY_RANSOMWARE_INFECTED_PROCESS { meta: Author = "US_CERT Code Analysis Team" Date = "1Apr16" File = "LOCKY RANSOMWARE UNPACKED" MD5 = "6A83A846244DDB4203902127294FD995" Info = "Signature based on Encryption Algorithm and DGA Algorithm"
strings: $b1 = {C1 C9 05 8B D0 C1 C2 0D 2A CA 32 CB} $b2 = {C1 C9 17 81 C1 68 2F 70 53 33 D1 40 89 55 EC} $b3 = {C1 C8 07 8D 84 30 01 00 10 27 69 C0 E1 24 19 B1 C1 C8 07 D1 E9}
condition: all of them }

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious IPv4 Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:

This is an embedded C2 IP contained within the Locky malware sample "78thg76.exe" (MD5: 6A83A846244DDB4203902127294FD995).

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
New IOC added for IB-16-10045C.
This is an embedded C2 IP contained within the Locky malware sample "78thg76.exe" (MD5: 6A83A846244DDB4203902127294FD995).

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious File Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
New IOC added for IB-16-10045D.
This file was seen as an attachment to an email with a subject line of "Document (1).pdf". These emails pretended to come from a network admin in an attempt to trick users into opening the attachments.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious File Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
New IOC added for IB-16-10045D.
This Locky Ransomware file was downloaded after users opened the malicious JS attachments.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Title: Malicious IPv4 Indicator
stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
New IOC added for IB-16-10045D.
This IPv4 was associated with bottlestore.com, which was seen delivering Locky Ransomware.
